verses.kjv: And again he entered into Capernaum after some days; and it was noised that he was in the house.
verses.web: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.
verses.ct: After a few days, Jesus returned to Capernaum, and word quickly spread that he was home.

verses.kjv: And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.
verses.web: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.
verses.ct: So many people crowded into the house that there wasn't even standing room left near the door. Jesus was teaching them God's word.

verses.kjv: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.
verses.web: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.
verses.ct: 4 men arrived carrying a paralyzed man on a mat, trying to bring him to Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
verses.web: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.
verses.ct: But they couldn't get anywhere near Jesus because of the crowd. So they climbed up on the roof, tore open a hole above where Jesus was standing, and lowered the paralyzed man down on his mat.

verses.kjv: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.
verses.web: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.ct: When Jesus saw how much faith they had, he said to the paralyzed man, "Son, your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.web: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.ct: Some of the religious scholars were sitting nearby, and they began questioning this in their minds:

verses.kjv: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
verses.web: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.ct: "How dare he say something like that? That's blasphemy! Only God can forgive sins."

verses.kjv: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
verses.web: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?
verses.ct: Jesus immediately knew in his spirit what they were thinking. He said to them, "Why are you questioning this in your hearts?

verses.kjv: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?
verses.web: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’
verses.ct: Which is easier — to tell this paralyzed man, 'Your sins are forgiven,' or to say, 'Get up, pick up your mat, and walk'?

verses.kjv: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)
verses.web: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—
verses.ct: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins." Then he turned to the paralyzed man and said,

verses.kjv: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.
verses.web: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”
verses.ct: "Get up, pick up your mat, and go home."

verses.kjv: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
verses.web: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
verses.ct: The man stood up immediately, grabbed his mat, and walked out in front of everyone. The whole crowd was stunned. They praised God, saying, "We've never seen anything like this!"

verses.kjv: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
verses.web: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.
verses.ct: Jesus went out again along the shore of the lake. A large crowd gathered around him, and he taught them.

verses.kjv: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
verses.web: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he arose and followed him.
verses.ct: As he walked along, he noticed Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at his tax collection booth. Jesus said to him, "Follow me." Levi got up and followed him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
verses.web: He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.
verses.ct: Later, Jesus was having dinner at Levi's house. Many tax collectors and sinners were eating with Jesus and his disciples, because a large number of them had begun following him.

verses.kjv: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
verses.web: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.ct: When the scribes and Pharisees saw Jesus eating with tax collectors and sinners, they asked his disciples, "Why does he eat and drink with people like that?"

verses.kjv: When Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.web: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.ct: Jesus overheard them and said, "Healthy people don't need a doctor — sick people do. I didn't come to call the righteous. I came to call sinners to repentance."

verses.kjv: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
verses.web: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.ct: The disciples of John and the Pharisees were observing a time of fasting. Some people came to Jesus and asked, "John's disciples fast, and the Pharisees' disciples fast — why don't your disciples fast?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Do wedding guests fast while the groom is still celebrating with them? Of course not! As long as the groom is with them, they can't fast.

verses.kjv: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
verses.web: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.
verses.ct: But the time will come when the groom is taken away from them, and then they will fast."

verses.kjv: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.
verses.web: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.
verses.ct: "Nobody patches an old garment with a piece of unshrunk cloth. If you do, the new patch will shrink and pull away from the old fabric, making the tear even worse.

verses.kjv: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.
verses.web: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”
verses.ct: Nobody pours new wine into old wineskins either. The new wine would burst the old skins, and you'd lose both the wine and the skins. New wine needs fresh wineskins."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.
verses.web: He was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.
verses.ct: One Sabbath, Jesus was walking through the grain fields, and his disciples began picking heads of grain as they went.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
verses.web: The Pharisees said to him, “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
verses.ct: The Pharisees confronted him: "Look! Why are your disciples doing what's not allowed on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?
verses.web: He said to them, “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry—he, and those who were with him?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Haven't you ever read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?

verses.kjv: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?
verses.web: How he entered into God’s house at the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?”
verses.ct: He went into God's house during the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the sacred bread that only priests were allowed to eat — and he shared it with his men."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
verses.web: He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "The Sabbath was made to serve people, not people to serve the Sabbath.

verses.kjv: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
verses.web: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.ct: So the Son of Man is Lord even over the Sabbath."
